trans-unit.source: Identifies the type of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] control.
ControlType inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier> and is used to identify the type of a control represented by an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
The control type is determined by the developer of the UI Automation provider.
This class contains static fields, which are themselves ControlType objects, to identify the standard types of controls.
There is also a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Custom> type for controls that do not match one of the defined types.
The only case where a control's control type might change at run time is where the control supports <xref:System.Windows.Automation.MultipleViewPattern>.

An example is the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_win32](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-win32-md.md)] list view, which can be a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataGrid> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List>, depending on the current view.
Control types do not have a one-to-one equivalence to control patterns.
A control can be of only one type, but it may support multiple patterns or no patterns at all, depending on its specific functionality.
For detailed information on the various control types, see [UI Automation Control Types](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies a button control.
Buttons perform a single action when clicked.
A button can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type.
For example, the drop-down arrow in a combo box control is a button.
When used as a subcontrol, a button is in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in the content view).
To be added.
Identifies a calendar control, such as a date-picker.
To be added.
Identifies a check box control.
A check box can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type.
For example, a check box at the beginning of a row in a grid control that is used to select the row (used to manipulate the content) appears in the control view but not in the content view.
However, a labeled checkbox in a form that represents data is in the content and control views.
To be added.
Identifies a combo box control.
There are two variations of combo box controls.
A simple combo box presents a list that a user can select from.
An editable combo box presents a list of choices and also has an editable text area where a user can type in a choice instead of being limited to selecting from the choices in the list.
To be added.
Identifies a control that is not one of the defined control types.

The Custom control type indicates a control that is not identified as one of the predefined control types (such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>).

Control developers should check the other control types before designating their control as a Custom control type to be sure that their control does not provide the same functionality as one of the defined control types.
A Custom control type requires extra work for the provider to implement [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].
Also, UI Automation client products will not be able to anticipate the control structure, keyboard interaction, and possible control patterns based on the control type of the control.
To be added.
Identifies a data grid control.
When the cells contain only text, the control type should be <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>.
To be added.
Identifies a data item control.
A DataItem is a complex item that can contain many other controls.
To be added.
Identifies a document control.
A document contains text content of more than one line.
To be added.
Identifies an edit control, such as a text box.
An Edit control can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type.
For example, the area where a user can type in a value in a combo box control is an Edit control, and in this case the control is not part of the content view.
Edit controls can also represent controls that contain passwords.
The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AutomationElementInformation.IsPassword%2A> property enables products such as screen readers to know whether to reveal the contents.
To be added.
Retrieves the pattern identifiers that are not supported by the control type.
This method is useful for UI Automation clients such as test frameworks for a provider implementation that need to find all control patterns that are not permitted on this control type.
An array of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] pattern identifiers.
Retrieves an array of sets of required patterns.
Each element of the array contains an array of patterns, and each element that has this control type must support at least one of these arrays.
This method is useful for UI Automation clients that need to find all possible patterns, such as testing frameworks for a provider implementation.
An array of sets of required patterns.
Retrieves an array of the required property [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_id#plural](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-idsharpplural-md.md)] for this control type.
This method is useful for UI Automation clients that need to find all possible properties, such as testing frameworks for a provider implementation.
An array of property [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_id#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-idsharpplural-md.md)].
Identifies a group control, which acts as a container for other controls.
A group is a container control that contains different control types and is used to logically associate those controls.
To be added.
Identifies a header control, which is a container for the labels of rows and columns of information.
To be added.
Identifies a header item, which is the label for a row or column of information.
To be added.
Identifies a hyperlink control.
A hyperlink control navigates to a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_url](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-url-md.md)] when a user clicks on the control.
To be added.
Identifies an image control.
An Image control type can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type.
For example, a button can use an image rather than text to indicate its functionality to the user.
When used only for decorative purposes, an image appears in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in the content view).
To be added.
Identifies a list control, such as a list box.
A List is a control type that contains <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> and (perhaps) <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control types.
A List control can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type.
For example, a combo box has a List control that contains choices that appear when the drop-down button is clicked.
When used as a subcontrol, a List is only in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in content view).
When used as a subcontrol, a List does not have a `Name` property assigned.
A List can contain <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> controls.
To be added.
Identifies a list item control, which is a child item of a list control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> can also be a child of a list control.
To be added.
Gets a description of the control type.
A localized description of the control type, such as "button".
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ControlType"></xref> that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.
Normally the type of a control is identified by a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> object.
This method enables you to construct such an object when only the numerical identifier is known.
Identifier of the control type.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ControlType"></xref> that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.
Identifies a menu control, such as a top-level menu in an application window.
A menu is a container for a collection of menu items; for instance, the control that appears beneath **File** when you click on it and that contains **New**, **Open**, and so on.
To be added.
Identifies a menu bar control, which generally contains a set of top-level menus.
A MenuBar control type represents the container for the set of top-level menus of an application.
To be added.
Identifies a menu item control.
A MenuItem is a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control.
To be added.
Identifies a pane control.
A Pane is used to visually separate content within a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>.
The user typically navigates between panes by pressing TAB, F6, or CTRL+TAB, depending on the context.
To be added.
Identifies a progress bar control, which visually indicates the progress of a lengthy operation.
To be added.
Identifies a radio button control, which is a selection mechanism allowing exactly one selected item in a group.
To be added.
Identifies a scroll bar control, such as a scroll bar in an application window.
A ScrollBar control type contains a set of buttons and a thumb control that enable a user using a mouse to scroll the contents of a window or item container.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AutomationElementInformation.AutomationId%2A> property to differentiate between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Button> elements that correspond to the large-increment, large-decrement, small-increment, and small-decrement buttons.
To be added.
Identifies a separator, which creates a visual division in controls like menus and toolbars.
To be added.
Identifies a slider control.

A Slider control type consists of a set of buttons associated with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control that enable a user to select from a set of items or set a numerical value from within a range.
To be added.
Identifies a spinner control.
A Spinner control type consists of a set of buttons that enable a user to select from a set of items or set a numerical value from within a range.
To be added.
Identifies a split button, which is a button that performs a default action and can also expand to a list of other possible actions.
To be added.
Identifies a status bar control.

StatusBar control types are generally subcontrols of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control type [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] elements.
To be added.
Identifies a tab control.
A Tab is a control type that contains at least one <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> child control.
To be added.
Identifies a tab item control, which represents a page of a tab control.
To be added.
Identifies a table.
A Table control type is similar to a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> but contains only text.
Tables can also contain <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control types.
To be added.
Identifies an edit control, such as a text box or rich text box.

A Text control can be used as a standalone control, such as an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control, or as a subcomponent, such as the area of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> where a user can type in a value.
To be added.
Identifies the control in a scrollbar that can be dragged to a different position.
A Thumb control is used as a subcontrol in a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control type.
As a subcontrol, a Thumb does not have a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.NameProperty>.
To be added.
Identifies the caption bar on a window.
To be added.
Identifies a toolbar, such as the control that contains a set of command buttons in an application window.
To be added.
Identifies a tooltip control, an informational window that appears as a result of moving the pointer over a control or sometimes when tabbing to a control using the keyboard.
To be added.
Identifies a tree control.
A Tree control type is a container for a hierarchical arrangement of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control types.
Each node of a tree can contain other nodes.
A node that contains child nodes can be displayed as expanded or collapsed.
To be added.
Identifies a node in a TreeItem control.
A TreeItem control type can be used only as a subcontrol of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control.
To be added.
Identifies a window frame, which contains child objects.
Controls of this type always support <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPattern>.
To be added.
